thread.title: Manipur Elections 2017 Live Updates: N Biren Singh to be sworn in today as chief minister of Manipur
thread.title_full: Manipur Elections 2017 Live Updates: N Biren Singh to be sworn in today as chief minister of Manipur

author: FE Online
title: Manipur Elections 2017 Live Updates: N Biren Singh to be sworn in today as chief minister of Manipur
text:
Manipur assembly elections 2017 Manipur Elections 2017 Live Updates: N Biren Singh to be sworn in today as chief minister of Manipur Manipur Elections 2017 Live Updates: N Biren Singh to be sworn in today as chief minister of Manipur Manipur Elections 2017 Live Updates: N Biren Singh was elected the leader of the 21-member BJP legislature party yesterday and is set to form the government By: FE Online | New Delhi | Updated: March 15, 2017 12:01 PM BJP leader N Biren Singh with Manipur governor Najma Heptullah. (Source: PTI) 
Manipur is set to witness its first BJP -led government as the Governor Najma Heptulla has invited N Biren Singh for the oath-taking ceremony today at 1 PM. N Biren Singh was elected the leader of the 21-member BJP legislature party yesterday and is set to form the government. Even though BJP failed to get a clear mandate, it has claimed support of 32 MLAs in the 60-member assembly. Besides the 21 party MLAs, BJP has the support of four NPP, and one legislator each of LJP, TMC and Congress . This will also mark the end of Okram Ibobi Singh’s dominance in the state who has been the Chief Minister of Manipur since 2002. 
Here are the live updates from Manipur: 
11:50 AM: Yesterday Manohar Parrikar took the oath the new Chief Minister of Goa and today when N Biren Singh will be sworn-in, it will the second state where BJP will form the government despite failing to be the single largest party by cobbling together a post-poll alliance. 
11:30 AM: Manipur Governor Najma Heptullah wasn’t pleased with the allegations put on her by Congress. While addressing the media yesterday, she said, “In my 37 years in Parliament and when I was in Congress or worked with non-Congress government, I never had such allegations been put on me. I invite the BJP-led group on Wednesday to form the government. The ceremony will begin at 1 pm.”
